column4: Hey everybody, I can't log into my linux dist. because I ran "sudo chage" and accidentally made the password expire.  I think I need to to use chmod but I don't know how.  Can someone help?
if you have no other sudo-enabled users, maybe you can boot into recovery mode; i don't know if there's an easier way
right now I'm on a live cd, I was in here earlier and someone mentioned using chmod.
oh, i don't know about the livecd approach...
it's usb.  still no?   Okay, I think i'll google chmod
alternatively, I don;t think i can boot into safe mode as root without the user password, do you know a way?
oh really? didn't know that...i thought maintenance mode logs you into root foryou...
there's a trick to get root shell from GRUB menu without any passwords but i don't think i should go around sharing it...
wait, i'm sorry im a bit of a newbie, how exactly do a log into safe mode then
I've tried rebooting and holding esc but that does nothing
when you restart your computer, do you get a little message that say, "press escape to enter the boot menu..." and it goes away after three seconds?
I use xubuntu, could that be why?
that boot menu should have a recovery mode. yeah, sometimes i don't get that either...i don't remember when you get it and when you don't
so what do you suggest I do?

here are the official instructions: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoveryMode once you do that, you have root access and you can try to undo whatever you did to lock yourself out (reset user passwords maybe)
i can't say that i've done this before though
